All associates shall go to the assembly area where they are to remain until released by management. Management shall designate an associate from that area to notify the fire department, Safety Manager and other emergency responders from the outside of the facility 


Each department supervisor is responsible for accounting for his/her personnel and reporting to the senior management representative present. The visitor book from the front desk should be brought out by office personnel and all visitors must be accounted for. Supply drivers will be checked to be certain they are by their truck or are signed out to be off the premises. 


No associate shall re-enter the facility until given permission by management. Attempts to rescue anyone trapped in the facility will be done by fire department personnel only. 

Basic first aid will be provided at the assembly area until fire department personnel can take over any injured persons. 


For more details see Supervisory Duties in Emergency Evacuation or the Process Safety Management manuals. 


All SmithFoods responders will have an annual full face respirator fit test and a pulmonary test. 
Any Responses requiring Hazmat (300 PPM) we will evacuate building and call in an Outside Hazmat team.


PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY

The SmithFoods is committed to continuous improvement of our policies, procedures, and facility. It is the intention of the SmithFoods to remain an industry leader. New technology, training techniques, and equipment are continuously being added to our system as they become available.

WORST AND ALTERNATE CASE SCENARIOS

These included external events, human error, piping, vessels, evaporators, compressors, pumps, heat exchangers, controls, and many others. The worst case release was selected due to the greater distance to endpoint. The alternate release was selected due to its more likely occurrence.

PROCESS DESCRIPTION:

SmithFoods Orrville Products Company - Ice Cream Processing produces ice cream and frozen distribution center.

5 YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

The SmithFoods Ice Cream Processing has had no reportable releases at our facility in the last 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PLAN: (Crisis Management Plan)

SmithFoods has established an in house Crisis Management Plan to quickly react to releases of Anhydrous Ammonia. The facility has established annual retraining for all personnel in Emergency Action Procedures for Ammonia with in the Crisis Management Plan.
In the event of an ammonia leak, associates should report it immediately to a supervisor. All other associates should be kept away from the affected area.

Mechanical Integrity Program: To prevent or minimize the consequences of catastrophic releases of ammonia, it is important to ensure process equipment is maintained properly. The purpose of an MI program is to maintain process equipment so that a catastrophic release of ammonia is avoided or properly contained. The emphasis should be on preventive maintenance rather than breakdown maintenance.

Many more specific programs and policies (Hot Work, Confined Space, Lockout / Tagout, Employee training, etc.) have been developed..

Procedures for conducting Compliance Audits, Mechanical Integrity Inspections, and Process Hazard Analyses have also been developed.

Process Hazard Analysis Re-validation will be completed before August 12, 2016. Will update when PHA is complete. The PHA highlighted some deficiencies in the system. These items were addressed as part of the continuous improvement of the facility. These items were addressed on the basis of priority (Injuries to personnel).

Plan views are included to allow the operator to physically locate equipment in the building.

The SmithFoods has developed and implemented a Process Safety / Risk Management Program and has organized the information and polices pertaining to the process into a complete library. 

Volume 1 of the PSM/RMP Library incorporates several policies. Many policies are included in Volume 1, the remaining are referenced from other training manuals maintained in the facility.

Employee Participation Guidelines: This policy outlines the commitment between management and employees to establish a program for a successful (safe) program.

Process Safety Information: This includes information on the ammonia inventory at the facility, applicable codes, design standards, and information pertaining to the hazards of ammonia (referenced from the IIAR ammonia Data Book).

Process Hazard Analysis Program: This program outlines a thorough, orderly, systematic approach for identifying, evaluating, and controlling potential hazards within a process involving potentially hazardous chemicals such as ammonia.

Operating Procedures: develop, implement, and maintain clearly written, detailed procedures, guidelines, rules, and practices for the safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration process during all operating phases. The operating procedures provide all employees involved in the operation and maintenance of the ammonia refrigeration process with the written information and precautions necessary to safety perform their tasks in a consistent manner.

Contractor Qualification Guidelines: This guideline has been established to verify that the contractors working in the facility are qualified to work on the system, trained in the hazards associated with their work, and made aware of the hazards presented by the facility to the employees of the contractor.

Management of Change and Pre-Startup Safety Review Programs: These programs have been developed to monitor and provide a checks and balances system to monitor changes

The SmithFoods, Ice Cream Production Facility is proud to inform all interested parties that our company is complying with OSHA's Process Safety Management Standard (PSM), Title 29 Code of Federal Regulations 1910.119, and EPA's Risk Management Program regulations (RMP), Title 40 CFR Part 68. In addition to other state and local codes applicable to our facility and process. We maintain this process to deal with the risks involved with the storage, handling, and use of Anhydrous Ammonia in our facility.

Our goal is to promote overall worker, public, and plant safety. The SmithFoods Orrville, Inc.. Ice Cream facility is located at 307 North Vine Street, Orville, Ohio. We manufacture frozen dairy products. The facility has processing tanks, piping, packaging equipment, raw materials warehousing, finished goods refrigerated storage, an Ammonia refrigeration engine room, boilers, and miscellaneous utilities. 

The Ice Cream Facility refrigeration system required for our production process necessitates the submission of this Risk Management Plan. The refrigeration system contains approximately 22,309 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. This surpasses the threshold quantity of 10,000 pounds outlined in Process Safety Management and Risk Management Program regulations.

ACCIDENTAL PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES:

The SmithFoods has implemented numerous policies and procedures to enable our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences of significant releases of Anhydrous Ammonia as well as other hazardous substances, fires, explosions, and other types of catastrophic accidents. Overall these programs prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, avoid property damage, and offsite impacts.  Our safety programs prevent accidents because they focus on the rules, procedures, and practices, which govern individual processes, activities, or pieces of equipment.
